article_title: EU Proposes Rules to Let Consumers Access Online Content When Abroad
article_text:
BRUSSELS—The European Union on Wednesday proposed new rules that would expand consumers’ access to content online and increase rights for online buyers as part of the bloc’s strategy to unify Europe’s fragmented digital market.

The European Commission—the bloc’s executive arm—proposed EU-wide rules to allow subscribers of online content, such as television, music, film or sports broadcasts, to access the media when traveling abroad...
